sub_title: Senior Sales Executive at Simac Retail
summary:
Sales and relationship management professional, over 15 years in sales, main domains retail, IT.
Multi level sales
Products; Software, Hardware & Services

Main goal add more value to retailers, by implenting smart solutions that increase sales and reduce costs

Specialties: Knowledge of Dutch retail market, main focus POS-, Merchandise Planning-, EFT-, Mobillity- & Security Solutions.

Ambition, Success, Growth are my key focus points

projects:
[{'title': "Tourism Summit Georgia '14 - Connecting and building strategic relationships", 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'In cooperation with two Georgian universities we conducted several market and cultural researches into the tourism industry, western European travelers and tourism possibilities in Georgia. During a three-day conference in Georgia Tbilisi we brought the Western European industry together with the Georgian industry. We informed both parties about the current tourism industry and what the future possibilities are. The consult that we gave to participants will affect their strategy, operational execution, marketing mix and marketing communication. 

Responsibilities: Sales, Marketing and Organization

Main objective: Bring the western European industry together with the Georgian industry to improve the tourism growth. 

Book Publication: Georgia Tourism Summit ‘ 14 – Connecting and building strategic relationships

Internet Publications:
http://tavisupali.ge/siakhleebi/1779-turizmis-samiti-shavi-zghvis-saerthashoriso-universitetshi.html?lang=ka-GE

http://newsday.ge/index.php?newsid=6685
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Oscar', 'last_name': 'Sauer', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Sales Executive at Simac Retail'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ronald', 'last_name': 'Wilmink', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director bij Hapam Vietnam Co., Ltd'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Lynne Limburgya', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Yassine', 'last_name': 'al Wahdani', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Interim Project Manager | RPA Consultant | Digital Transformation Consultant'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Thomas', 'last_name': 'van de Gronden', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Transaction Services Account Manager bij ING'}]}, {'title': 'Minor - European Business Skills (EBS)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'EBS (European Business Skills) is an elective course (so-called minor) of 30 study credits. 
There are a few reasons why HvA offers this course: 
- allowing the part-time student to experience short-stay intensive international mobility
- to make it possible to speed up study programmes, by making better use of the non-lesson periods within the academic year. The modules we presently can offer are:

- Summer school: cross-cultural country knowledge of all European Union member states. Always organised in a Southern-European country towards the end of June. Duration: two weeks abroad, predeparture assignments at home
- Market research for Dutch Embassy. Depending on the prefered market and availability of adequate students and project funding, we opt for one or two Embassies per semester
- Winter school: communication skills, from a Euro-Asian perspective. 
Location: always organised in an Asian location in February. Our partner school is in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Duration: two weeks abroad, predeparture assignments at home.

We afterwards plan to add a distance learning module as well (in English), on European Leadership.

There has been a large field research into the B2B market and into the Polish customers to receive consumer insights. Alongside a cultural market scan was developed to show cultural difference between Dutch and Polish traders and consumers. In February 2014 a seminar was organized at the Dutch Embassy in Warsaw were we presented the participants the key findings of the research and a booklet. During this seminar we provided participants marketing and strategic advise about how to develop more trade and business growth in Poland. 

Main objective: The improvement of the trade relations between Dutch and Polish entrepreneurs in the market for cut flowers and flower bulbs. 

Give Polish entrepreneurs more consumer insights to change their marketing mix were needed. 

Initiator; Dutch Embassy in Warsaw

Book Publication: Flourishing Trade – A market and culture scan of the Polish flowers and flower bulbs market.

Responsibilities: Overall management, Sales, Marketing, Market research, organization and contact person for Polish counterparts.
